intro: Erigeron aequifolius, commonly known as the Mexican Fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are white to pale blue in color. Erigeron aequifolius is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
